access.accessibility_details: Uphill walk on paved path with some stairs. Path is narrow in places. Not suitable for wheelchairs but manageable for most fitness levels.

details.description_long: Punta Bonfiglio is Manarola's prized viewpoint, located on a rocky promontory just above the village. This spot offers the classic postcard view of Manarola that has made it one of the most photographed locations in Italy. From here, visitors can see the pastel-colored tower houses cascading down the rocky cliff to the tiny harbor, with the Mediterranean Sea stretching to the horizon. The viewpoint includes a rest area with a kids' playground and benches, plus a popular bar (Nessun Dorma) just below. Nearby are the ruins of an old chapel once used as shelter by local farmers. The view extends west to Punta Mesco and beyond, with clear skies revealing the Maritime Alps and even Corsica. This is the quintessential Cinque Terre experience.
details.description_short: The most iconic and photographed viewpoint in Cinque Terre, offering breathtaking views of Manarola's colorful houses stacked on cliffs above the sea.

directions.from_harbor: Take the coastal path from the marina heading north, approximately 5 minutes walk
directions.from_main_street: Walk through village streets towards the harbor, then take path to the right
directions.from_train_station: Exit station tunnel, walk towards harbor, then follow path uphill to the right for 10 minutes
